sen.j: 星川稚宮皇子（ほしかわのわかみやのみこ、生年不詳 - 雄略天皇23年（479年））は、『日本書紀』に伝えられる古墳時代の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Hoshikawa no Wakamiya no miko (year of birth unknown - the 23rd year of the reign of Emperor Yuryaku (479), was a member of the Imperial family (Royal family), who was said to be living during the Kofun period (tumulus period) according to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 雄略天皇23年→定訳不明：the 23rd year of the reign of Emperor Yuryakuとしました。
sen.e: Hoshikawa no Wakamiya no miko (year of birth unknown - the 23rd year of the reign of Emperor Yuryaku (479), was a member of the Imperial family (Royal family), who is said to have lived in the Kofun period (tumulus period) according to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: was said to be living during をis said to have lived in に変更
sen.e: Hoshikawa no Wakamiya no miko (year of birth unknown - 479), was a member of the Imperial family (Royal family), who is said to have lived in the Kofun period (tumulus period) according to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 西暦479年the 23rd year of the reign of Emperor Yuryaku (the 23rd year of the reign of Emperor Yuryaku (479))→479

sen.j: 雄略天皇と吉備上道臣氏出身の吉備稚媛との間の子で、磐城皇子の弟。
sen.e: He was the son of Emperor Yuryaku and KIBI no Wakahime from the Kibi no Kamitsumichi no omi clan, and he was the younger brother of Iwaki no miko.
sen.cmt: 吉備稚媛→KIBI no Wakahimeと表記しました。 吉備上道臣氏→the Kibi no Kamitsumichi no omi clanとしました。
sen.e: He was a son of Emperor Yuryaku and KIBI no Wakahime from the Kibi no Kamitsumichi no omi clan, and he was a younger brother of Iwaki no miko.
He was a son of Emperor Yuryaku and KIBI no Wakahime from the Kibi no Kamitsumichi no omi clan, and he was a younger brother of Iwaki no miko.

sen.j: 雄略天皇の死後に反乱を起こしたという。
sen.e: It is said that he rose in rebellion after Emperor Yuryaku's death.
It is said that he rose in rebellion after Emperor Yuryaku's death.
It is said that he rose in rebellion after Emperor Yuryaku's death.

sen.j: 一般に「稚宮」を省略して星川皇子と呼ばれることが多い。
sen.e: He is usually called Hoshikawa no miko, by omitting the two letters (稚宮) that read 'wakamiya.'
sen.cmt: 漢字表記 「(稚宮) 」を加えました。
sen.e: He is usually called Hoshikawa no miko, by omitting the two letters (稚宮) that read 'wakamiya.'
He is usually called Hoshikawa no miko, by omitting the two letters (稚宮) that read 'wakamiya.'

sen.j: 『古事記』は系譜・反乱伝承ともに欠いている。
sen.e: "Kojiki "(The Records of Ancient Matters) lacks his genealogy as well as the description about his rebellion.
"Kojiki "(The Records of Ancient Matters) lacks his genealogy as well as the description about his rebellion.

sen.j: 雄略天皇は吉備上道臣田狭が自分の妻・稚媛の美しさを自慢するのを聞いて、田狭を任那の国司として派遣した後で、稚媛を奪って妃とした。
sen.e: As Emperor Yuryaku heard KIBI no Kamitsumichi no omi Tasa boast the beauty of his wife Wakahime, he dispatched Tasa to Mimana (in Korean Peninsula) as kokushi (the provincial governor), and seized the occasion to rob Tasa's wife and took her as his own wife.
sen.cmt: 吉備上道臣田狭→KIBI no Kamitsumichi no omi Tasaと表記しました。
sen.e: As Emperor Yuryaku heard KIBI no Kamitsumichi no omi Tasa boast the beauty of his wife Wakahime, he dispatched Tasa to Mimana (in the Korean Peninsula) as kokushi (the provincial governor), and seized the occasion to kidnap Tasa's wife and took her as his own wife.
sen.cmt: Korean Penisulaの前にtheを追加。robを kidnap に変更。
sen.e: As Emperor Yuryaku heard KIBI no Kamitsumichi no omi Tasa boast the beauty of his wife Wakahime, he dispatched Tasa to Mimana (in the Korean Peninsula) as kokushi (the provincial governor), and seized the occasion to kidnap Tasa's wife and took her as his own wife.

sen.j: こうして磐城皇子と星川皇子が生まれた。
sen.e: In this marriage, Iwaki no miko and Hoshikawa no miko were born.
Consequently, Iwaki no miko and Hoshikawa no miko were born.
sen.cmt: In this marriage をConsequently に変更
sen.e: Consequently, Iwaki no miko and Hoshikawa no miko were born.

sen.j: 稚媛は雄略天皇が死ぬと、星川皇子に反乱を起こすよう説いた。
sen.e: After Emperor Yuryaku's death, Wakahime persuaded Hoshikawa no miko to foment a rebellion.
After Emperor Yuryaku's death, Wakahime persuaded Hoshikawa no miko to foment a rebellion.
After Emperor Yuryaku's death, Wakahime persuaded Hoshikawa no miko to foment a rebellion.

sen.j: 星川皇子は母の言葉に従い、反乱を起こし、大蔵を占領した。
sen.e: Hoshikawa no miko followed his mother's words and rose in rebellion, taking over Okura.
sen.cmt: 大蔵→定訳不明：Okura どのような場所を指すのか不明なので、音表記してあります。
sen.e: Hoshikawa no miko followed his mother's words and rose in rebellion, taking over Okura.
Hoshikawa no miko followed his mother's words and rose in rebellion, taking over Okura.

sen.j: しかし大蔵に火を放たれ、星川皇子と稚媛のほか従った者の多くが焼き殺された。
sen.e: However, Okura was set fire and Hoshikawa no miko, Wakahime and many of their followers were burned to death.
However, Okura was set on fire and Hoshikawa no miko, Wakahime and many of their followers were killed in the fire.
sen.cmt: set fire をset on fireに変更。「焼き殺される」をwere killed in the fireに訳出し。
sen.e: However, Okura was set on fire and Hoshikawa no miko, Wakahime and many of their followers were killed in the fire.

sen.j: 吉備上道臣氏は星川皇子を助けようと軍を率いて大和に向かったが、殺されたことを聞いて途中で引き返した。
sen.e: To save Hoshikawa no miko, the Kibi no Kamitsumichi no omi clan set out toward Yamato Province, leading the troops, however, being informed that the Hoshikawa no miko was killed, they drew back.
To save Hoshikawa no miko, the Kibi no Kamitsumichi no omi clan set out toward Yamato Province, leading the troops, however, being informed that Hoshikawa no miko was killed, they drew back.

sen.e: To save Hoshikawa no miko, the Kibi no Kamitsumichi no omi clan set out toward Yamato Province, leading the troops, however, being informed that Hoshikawa no miko was killed, they drew back.

sen.j: 清寧天皇はこれを非難して、吉備上道臣が管理している山部を召し上げたという。
sen.e: Emperor Seinei accused the Kibi clan of this move and confiscated the mountain area that had been under the control of the Kibi no Kamitsumichi no omi clan.
sen.cmt: 山部→定訳不明：mountain areaとしました。
sen.e: Emperor Seinei accused the Kibi clan of this move and confiscated the mountain area that had been under the control of the Kibi no Kamitsumichi no omi clan.

sen.j: なお、滋賀県米原市の朝妻神社には、皇子の墓と称する宝篋印塔がある。
sen.e: At Asatsuma-jinja Shrine in Yonehara City, Shiga Prefecture, there is a pagoda called Hokyoin-to, which is said to be the tomb of Hoshikawa no miko.
sen.cmt: 宝篋印塔亜→a pagoda called Hokyoin-to としました。
